snippet: The trillion-dollar spending plan finances the government through September, reverses some cuts to military veterans’ pensions and defeats efforts to curb President Obama’s health care law.
abstract: House and Senate negotiators reach accord on trillion-dollar spending plan that will finance government through September 2014; plan reverses some cuts to military veterans’ pensions that were included in broader budget agreement and defeats efforts to rein in Pres Obama's health care law.
lead_paragraph: The trillion-dollar spending plan finances the government through September, reverses some cuts to military veterans’ pensions and defeats efforts to curb President Obama’s health care law.

headline.main: House and Senate Negotiators Agree on Spending Bill
headline.print_headline: House and Senate Negotiators Agree on Spending Bill
